, J.W. Lee leg. (YNU).
Redescription. FEMALE. Body length 2.8–3.1 mm ; LFW 1.8 mm .

Color . Head: mandible black, antenna castaenous. Mesosoma dark castaneous; fore wing subhyaline, veins castaenous; legs yellow except coxa and femora dark castaenous, tarsal claw dark castaenous. Metasoma black.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–8.
Goniozus akitushimanus
. 1. Habitus; 2. Head; 3. Mandible and clypeus; 4. Antenna; 5. Pronotum and mesonotum; 6. Fore wing; 7. Propodeal disc; 8. Metasoma. Scale bar: 0.10 mm for 7; 0.20 mm for 2–5; 0.50 mm for 1, 6, 8.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Mesosoma
(
Figs 5–7
): Pronotum coriaceous, 0.5 × as long as wide with sparse hairs, antero-lateral corner rounded. Mesoscutum coriaceous; notauli absent; parapsidal furrows thin and anteriorly divergent. Scutellum polish and coriaceous with sparse small punctures; scutellar pits oval, oblique and connected by very thin transverse groove, pit aparted from each other by 4.2 × as wide as their maximum. Propodeal disc 0.6 × as long as wide; lateral carina complete, transverse carina present only postero-lateral corner; disc coriaceous except median longitudinal smooth surface, distally broaden in dorsal view; declivity weakly coriaceous with complete marginal carina; lateral surface coriaceous. Fore wing with short hairs and closed areolet; radial vein curved outward at apex; pterostigma 0.16 mm long; metacarpo absent.
Distribution. Korea (GG, GW, CB, CN, Daejeon, JB, JN, GB), Japan (Honshu, Kyushu). Newly recorded from Korea .

Remarks. This is most common species among Korean
Goniozus
.
